text: Valeri Petrovich Yandemirov (; 11 February 1963 – 16 November 2017) was a Russian chess player. ==Biography== Born in Kazan, Tatarstan, Yandemirov was awarded the titles of International Master, in 1993, and Grandmaster, in 1997, by FIDE. In the European Club Cup, he won three team medals: a silver, in 2006, and a bronze, in 2004, playing for team Ladya of Kazan, and a bronze in 1995 playing for Poliot of Chelyabinsk.Valery Yandemirov team chess record at Olimpbase.org He died in his home on 16 November 2017."In Memoriam: GM Valeri Yandemirov". Chessdom. 16 November 2017. ==References== ==External links== *Valeri Yandemirov games at 365Chess.com * Category:1963 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Chess grandmasters Category:Russian chess players Category:Sportspeople from Kazan
title: Valeri Yandemirov
